summary: The 2010 Census was the costliest in the nation's history—roughly $12.3 billion. The U.S. Census Bureau is planning innovations for the 2020 Census which may lower costs, including re-engineering field operations and allowing the public to respond using the Internet. While these innovations show promise for controlling costs, their novelty also introduces new risks. In today's testimony we discuss the Bureau's need to fully test...
title: 2020 Census: Sustained Attention to Innovations, IT Systems, and Cost Estimation Is Needed
